articles.title: Polish police find body of Syrian man near Belarus border - Reuters
articles.description: The body of a young Syrian man has been found in Poland near the border with Belarus, Polish police said on Saturday, amid mounting international tension over a migrant crisis the European Union says has been orchestrated by Minsk.
articles.content: Trucks from 16th Pomeranian Mechanised Division are seen behind a barbed wire at the temporary camp during migrant crisis on Belarusian - Polish border near Siemianowka, Poland, November 12, 2021. RE… [+2803 chars]

articles.author: Patrick Daly
articles.title: Christmas lockdown should be avoided as winter Covid wave unlikely, says expert - Evening Standard
articles.description: Professor Neil Ferguson’s comments come amid rising cases in Europe, with restrictions reimposed in some countries to control a new surge.
articles.content:
The expert whose modelling helped instigate the first coronavirus lockdown said he does not think restrictions will be needed this Christmas.
Professor Neil Ferguson a member of the Scientific Advis… [+4368 chars]

articles.author: Órla Ryan
articles.title: Poll: Are you planning to travel to anywhere in Europe this winter? - TheJournal.ie
articles.description: A Facebook friend request earlier this year changed Maria Arbuckle’s life forever.
articles.content:
MARIA ARBUCKLE GAVE birth to her eldest child, Paul, in March 1981.
She wanted to raise him, but was a teenager, unmarried and had no-one to turn to.
Maria, now 59, grew up in care and was separate… [+17840 chars]

articles.title: Netherlands enters 3-week partial lockdown after COVID surge - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: Bars, restaurants and non-essential shops to close early.
articles.content:
The Dutch government on Friday announced a three-week partial lockdown, with restaurants and shops to close early, after a spike in coronavirus cases.
